rbw.simulation package¶

High-level interface for rigid body physics using pybullet.

Submodules¶

rbw.simulation.interface module¶

A collection of functions interfacing with pybullet simulations

Implemented as functions rather than classes to facilitate cross-language support.

rbw.simulation.interface.apply_state(sim, ids, state)[source]¶
rbw.simulation.interface.batch_step(sim, ids, g, dur, time_step=240, time_scale=1.0, prev_state=None, debug=False)[source]¶

Obtains sim state from simulation.

Currently returns the position of each rigid body. The total duration is equal to frames / fps

Parameters

  • dur (float) – The amount of time in seconds to simulate

  • objects ([str]) – List of strings of objects to report

  • time_step (int, optional) – Number of physics steps per second

  • fps (int, optional) – Number of frames to report per second.

rbw.simulation.interface.init_sim_serialized(sim, str_data, cid)[source]¶
rbw.simulation.interface.keypoints(states)[source]¶

The time points and graphs at moments where new contacts form or dissolve

Parameters

states (np.array) – an array containing nx.digraph state representations

Returns

Keys represent contact change points. Values are a tuple where lhs is the graph at time t, and the rhs is itself a tuple of (new edges, removed edges).

Return type

dict

rbw.simulation.interface.parse_state(states, names, hz)[source]¶

Collects the states of objects in space-time

Parameters

  • states (np.array) – an array containing nx.digraph state representations

  • names (iterable(str)) – Nodes to collect

  • hz (int) – how many collections to report per state step

Returns

Return type

something

rbw.simulation.interface.run_full_trace(client, graph, T=1.0, fps=60, time_scale=1.0, time_step=240, debug=False)[source]¶

Runs pybullet on on given scene Frames per second are fixed at 60 If no objects are given, then the top keys of serialized_scene are used.

Parameters

  • data – Dict representing scene

  • objs,optional – Order of objects to report.

  • T – The duration in seconds to simulate

  • fps – The rate at which to report state

  • time_scale – The time scale factor

  • debug – Whether to run with debug visualization

New_world
